properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms into this evening. These thunderstorms have the potential to produce strong gusts, hail and heavy rain. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T05:59:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T02:19:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2003449112.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected Thursday. A hot air mass is expected to pay a brief visit to the Thunder Bay area on Thursday, with afternoon temperatures near 30°C expected. Humidex values may reach the mid thirties. Cooler air from Lake Superior is expected to return by Thursday evening, with temperatures remaining somewhat lower Friday into the weekend. These conditions pose a health risk when you are not used to the heat. Everyone is at risk from heat, especially older adults; infants and young children; and people with chronic illnesses. You are advised to 1) drink plenty of cool liquids before feeling thirsty; and 2) keep cool by dressing for the weather and spending a few hours each day in a cool place. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T09:55:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T01:56:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0652002958.2019
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:52 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from Abitibi to 50 kilometres northeast of Missonga, moving east at 65 km/h. Locations impacted include: Iroquois Falls, Potter, Tunis, Lower Sturgeon, Berylvale, Nellie Lake, Wings, Arpin, Onagon, Norembega, Montrock, Ansonville, Twin Falls and Bingle. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-27T04:15:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T01:53:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3252408673.2019
Area: Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. The threat of thunderstorms with nickel size hail, heavy downpours and frequent lightning will continue into the evening for eastern portions of the Fraser Valley. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T05:43:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T01:46:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2787421864.2019
Area: Fraser Valley - central including Chilliwack, Fraser Valley - east including Hope

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. The threat of thunderstorms with nickel size hail, heavy downpours and frequent lightning will continue into the evening for the western and central Fraser Valley - largely north of the Fraser, in mountainous terrain. AT 7:20 pm, an area of thunderstorms west of Harrison Lake is approaching the Stave Lake area and could reach the area within the next 30-40 minutes. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T05:43:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T02:30:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0797632282.2019
Area: Fraser Valley - west including Abbotsford, Fraser Valley - central including Chilliwack
